page.title: 01BATTYEFORD 1985
page.content: { Battyeford}is a small part of the area of{Mirfield(POP:1981 18,687).}Now it is really a{dormitory town}serving a much larger area.The proximity of the{M1 & M62}enable many people to travel to work daily in such towns as {Leeds,Manchester,Sheffield}and with the{"Yorkshire Pullman"}train{London. The area is mainly modern estates with some older properties down by the{Calder}near{Half-penny Bridge,}and up at{Clifton,}although there are some very fine big houses which once belonged to the mill owners. Industry has declined,although there are still textile firms along the floor of the valley,some of the mills have been converted to a variety of light industries.One is now a{Pig Farm PATTERSONS much to the annoyance of most of the population,especially on warm,breezy days,{IN FACT MOST DAYS.
